title: Unable to log in without a VPN
body:
Here is the primary error from the LolClient log.

>[ERROR] com.riotgames.platform.gameclient.module.services.RemoteObjectGenerator 0001 ChannelSet ChannelFaultEvent: [ChannelFaultEvent faultCode="Channel.Connect.Failed" faultString="error" faultDetail="undefined url:'rtmps://prod.oc1.lol.riotgames.com:2099'" channelId="my-rtmps" type="channelFault" bubbles=false cancelable=false eventPhase=2]

I am able to log into the game via a VPN. I can start a game, then when loaded into the game, disconnect the VPN. I will be disconnected from the game and automatically reconnected. I can play the game using my own internet, however when the game is over, and I'm sent back to the adobe air client, I'm disconnected and must repeat the entire process over again.

ISP: Foxtel
Location: Perth, Western Australia

replies.body:
That sounds pretty strange.

If you can connect while on VPN but not normally, it sounds like problems getting from your ISP to the league platform.  Using a VPN would force your traffic to take a different (working) path

Can you test something for me:

* You'll need to use  [telnet](http://windows.microsoft.com/en-au/windows/telnet-faq#1TC=windows-7) to test access to the League platform.
* Start with your VPN **OFF**
* Open a command prompt and type _telnet prod.oc1.lol.riotgames.com 2099_
 * If it works, you'll see _Connecting To prod.oc1.lol.riotgames.com..._ very briefly, and then the prompt will go away (you can just press spacebar a few times to get it to close out the connection).
 * If it fails, you will see something like _Could not open connection to the host, on port 2099: Connect failed_
* Try the test again with your VPN **ON**

Let me know how it goes.

Cheers
Mindstar
Final reply: If you guys changed something network-related in the past 12 hours from this message, it fixed whatever happened. If not, my ISP must have fixed it without any prompting from me.
Any luck? I'd love to play LoL but until I get this sorted, no dice.
Just completed. Both with and without the VPN seem to successfully connect(prompt goes away after a brief 'connecting to etc etc' message.

PubGamer a number of us are having trouble connecting at the moment and we all have iPrimus network providers (iPrimus and Dodo) if you're using one that uses the same network it could be because of that, it might be a provider issue.
I don't think it's related. This has been an issue since the last patch(monday/tuesday night?)
